Package com.scheduler.business

Class CustomerService

java.lang.Object
com.scheduler.business.CustomerService
public class CustomerService extends Object
Class performs business logic operations on Customer objects. Implemented using a Singleton pattern to simplify keeping Customer objects in sync across Front End and Business Logic, and between those objects and the Database.
Author:
Dillon Christensen

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomerService

      private CustomerService()
      Constructor: Sets up DAO to create a list of customers, pulled from the database. Sets up instances of Division and Country Services. Populate front end helper field.
      See Also:
      • Division Service
      • Country Service

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static CustomerService getInstance()
      Creates singleton instance if it was not created already, then gets the instance.
      Returns:
      Singleton instance

    • populateExtendedAddressField

      private void populateExtendedAddressField(Customer customer)
      Creates a string from existing Customer fields and sets the 'extendedAddress' field as the newly created string.
      Parameters:
      customer - Customer instance to be modified
      See Also:
      • Customer

    • getAllCustomers

      public List<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      Gets a list of all customers.
      Returns:
      list of customers or empty list if none are found

    • getCustomerById

      public Customer getCustomerById(int id)
      Gets the Customer associated with the given ID value.
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier used to query Customer
      Returns:
      Matching Customer instance or null if none was found

    • createCustomer

      public Customer createCustomer(Customer customer)
      Creates a Customer in the database from the given instance. If successful, populate front end helper fields, such as extendedAddress and add the newly created instance to customers.
      Parameters:
      customer - Customer to be created on database
      Returns:
      newly created Customer instance or null if creation was not successful

    • deleteCustomer

      public Customer deleteCustomer(int id)
      Deletes a Customer from the database. If successful, remove the Customer associated with the given ID from customers.
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier to query Customer
      Returns:
      deleted Customer instance or null if deletion failed

    • updateCustomer

      public Customer updateCustomer(Customer customer)
      Updates a Customer in the database. If successful, remove the defunct Customer from customers and add the updated one.
      Parameters:
      customer - Customer instance to update
      Returns:
      updated Customer instance or null if update failed

    • getCustomersByCountryName

      public List<Customer> getCustomersByCountryName(String countryName)
      Gets all Customers of the given Country name from customers.
      Parameters:
      countryName - name String of the Country to filter Customers
      Returns:
      List of Customers filtered by countryName or empty List if none are found

    • getCustomerNames

      public List<String> getCustomerNames()
      Gets all Customer names from customers.
      Returns:
      List of name Strings or empty List if none exist

    • getIdByName

      public int getIdByName(String name)
      Gets Customer id by the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - unique identifier used to query Customer
      Returns:
      id of matching Customer or -1 if not found

    • getNameById

      public String getNameById(int id)
      Gets Customer name by the given id.
      Parameters:
      id - unique identifier used to query Customer
      Returns:
      name of matching Customer or empty String literal if not found
